intro: Dionysia sarvestanica subsp. spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dionysia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The subspecies is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and parts of western Asia. Its leaves are typically lanceolate or spatulate in shape, with a hairy surface. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
